references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of diffusion models, introducing the core concept of denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPMs) which underpins much of the later work described in the provided document.

This paper introduces the Variational Autoencoder (VAE), a generative model framework that is conceptually similar to diffusion models and whose theoretical underpinnings are relevant to understanding diffusion models, as discussed in the provided document.

references.paper_title: Maximum likelihood training of score-based diffusion models
references.reason: This paper significantly advances the training methodology of score-based diffusion models, providing the theoretical justification for much of the training methodologies used in the paper provided.
This paper introduces Neural Ordinary Differential Equations (NODEs), a technique used in the provided paper for efficiently calculating the time-derivative of the forward process.

This paper introduces RealNVP, a type of normalizing flow that is used in the provided paper as a method of efficiently computing the log-determinant of the jacobian in the calculation of the score function.
